titlestmt.titleproper: Josef Gugler African and Middle Eastern Film Collection. Series 2. Audiovisual Recordings, 1968-2013 COL 12 (VAD7505)
titlestmt.subtitle: A Guide to His Holdings at the Indiana University Black Film Center/Archive
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by BFC/A Staff

note.p: © 2016 Trustees of Indiana University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-07-02 04:02:22 -0400.

change.item: Batch update to change subject links.

did.unittitle: Josef Gugler African and Middle Eastern Film Collection. Series 2. Audiovisual Recordings

physdesc.physfacet: DVD, VCD, laser discs, DVDR, CDR

did.abstract: The Josef Gugler collection consists of promotional materials for films produced in or directed by filmmakers from Africa and the Middle East. Over 500 unique films by approximately 350 film directors are represented. Formats include film posters, pressbooks, chirashi flyers, lobby and storefront cards, handbills, photographs, slides, and audiovisual recordings.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in multiple languages, predominantly French, English, and German, but also Arabic, Hebrew, Japanese, and various other European and Asian languages.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The materials in this collection are open to the public.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following three series:

list.item: * Subseries 3.5. Lobby cards, store front cards, and oversized publicity photos, 1966-2010

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Josef Gugler collection consists of promotional materials for films produced in or directed by filmmakers from Africa and the Middle East. Over 500 unique films by approximately film directors are represented.

The materials in this series consist of videorecordings, soundtracks, and electronic press kits for approximately 300 films by around 175 filmmakers. The most commonly represented countries of production are Burkina Faso, Egypt, Morocco, Tunisia, France, Israel/Palestine, Senegal, and South Africa. The content is recorded in a variety of languages, often with French and/or English subtitles.

Most notable among the audiovisual materials are 16 mm prints of three of Ousmane Sembéne's films: Mandabi, Tauw, and Xala, as well as Sara Maldoror's Sambizanga and an episode of the BBC television show Woza Albert! Also included in this series are over 200 commercial DVDs and VHS tapes, two dozen soundtracks on LP and CD, a dozen electronic press kits, and 142 VHS and DVD-R/CD-Rs that appear to be either duplicates of other items in this series or screening and preview copies received from the filmmaker or production company although the provenance is generally unidentified.
A description of the full scope and content of the collection and Gugler's biography are available on the main collection finding aid at: http://purl.dlib.indiana.edu/iudl/findingaids/bfca/VAD5484.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The material in this collection was donated by Josef Gugler to the Indiana University Black Film Center Archives in summer 2015.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Materials may be used in-house at the BFC/A; duplication permitted only with permission of the Archivist. Use of audiovisual materials may require the creation of a reference copy. If you wish to preview a VHS recording in this collection, please contact the BFC/A staff well in advance of your visit.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [item], Josef Gugler Collection, Special Collection COL 12, Black Film Center/Archive, Indiana University, Bloomington.
